clusters.title: Hurricane Melissa could be strongest to ever hit Jamaica

items.title: Hurricane Melissa could be strongest to ever hit Jamaica
items.standfirst: Melissa has been upgraded to a category five storm and could become Jamaica's strongest on record.
items.content: Melissa has been upgraded to a category five storm and could become Jamaica's strongest on record.

items.title: Caribbean on alert as hurricane Melissa threatens devastation
items.standfirst: Hurricane Melissa, a powerful Category 4 storm, is threatening a direct hit on Jamaica after already causing fatalities in Haiti and the Dominican Republic. Authorities warn of widespread damage, prolonged power outages, and isolated communities, with tropical storm conditions expected to last several days. The hurricane, fueled by unusually warm ocean waters, may intensify to Category 5.
items.content: Hurricane Melissa, a powerful Category 4 storm, is threatening a direct hit on Jamaica after already causing fatalities in Haiti and the Dominican Republic. Authorities warn of widespread damage, prolonged power outages, and isolated communities, with tropical storm conditions expected to last several days. The hurricane, fueled by unusually warm ocean waters, may intensify to Category 5.

items.title: Hurricane Melissa threatens to bring catastrophic flooding to Jamaica
items.standfirst: Hurricane Melissa strengthened into a Category 5 storm early Monday, unleashing torrential rain and threatening to bring catastrophic flooding to the northern Caribbean.
items.content: Hurricane Melissa strengthened into a Category 5 storm early Monday, unleashing torrential rain and threatening to bring catastrophic flooding to the northern Caribbean.

items.title: Hurricane Melissa strengthens to category 5 as evacuations ordered in Jamaica’s capital
items.standfirst: Storm could intensify further, threatening to cause catastrophic flooding in northern CaribbeanHurricane Melissa strengthened into a powerful category 5 hurricane on Monday, threatening days of catastrophic winds and rain in the northern Caribbean, while Jamaica’s government ordered mandatory evacuations for vulnerable areas across the country including in the capital, Kingston.Jamaican officials had earlier urged those in low-lying and flood-prone areas to seek refuge as Melissa rapidly climbs up the Saffir-Simpson hurricane wind scale. Continue reading...
items.content: Storm could intensify further, threatening to cause catastrophic flooding in northern CaribbeanHurricane Melissa strengthened into a powerful category 5 hurricane on Monday, threatening days of catastrophic winds and rain in the northern Caribbean, while Jamaica’s government ordered mandatory evacuations for vulnerable areas across the country including in the capital, Kingston.Jamaican officials had earlier urged those in low-lying and flood-prone areas to seek refuge as Melissa rapidly climbs up the Saffir-Simpson hurricane wind scale. Continue reading...

items.title: Melissa intensifies to Category 5 hurricane as Jamaica braces for landfall
items.standfirst: Hurricane Melissa strengthened to a powerful Category 5 on Monday, with destuctive winds and major winds expected to intensify in Jamaica. Forecasted to make landfall on Jamaica on Tuesday, Melissa is set to be the strongest hurricane in recent history to directly hit the Caribbean island.
items.content: Hurricane Melissa strengthened to a powerful Category 5 on Monday, with destuctive winds and major winds expected to intensify in Jamaica. Forecasted to make landfall on Jamaica on Tuesday, Melissa is set to be the strongest hurricane in recent history to directly hit the Caribbean island.

items.title: Hurricane Melissa intensifies to Category 5 storm, threatens Jamaica with 'catastrophic' flooding
items.standfirst: Hurricane Melissa intensified to a powerful Category 5 storm early Monday as forecasters warned it would cause catastrophic flash flooding, life-threatening landslides and extremely strong winds across the Caribbean
items.content: Hurricane Melissa intensified to a powerful Category 5 storm early Monday as forecasters warned it would cause catastrophic flash flooding, life-threatening landslides and extremely strong winds across the Caribbean

items.title: Melissa strengthens to a Category 5 hurricane as it nears Jamaica
items.standfirst: Melissa is forecast to make landfall on the island of Jamaica Tuesday, with up to 30 inches of rain and a life-threatening storm surge. Category 5 is the highest on the Saffir-Simpson scale.
items.content: Melissa is forecast to make landfall on the island of Jamaica Tuesday, with up to 30 inches of rain and a life-threatening storm surge. Category 5 is the highest on the Saffir-Simpson scale.(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)

items.title: Hurricane Melissa is a mighty Category 5 storm in the Caribbean
items.standfirst: Melissa strengthened into the most powerful category a hurricane could and could bring "catastrophic" flash flooding and landslides to Jamaica, Haiti and the Dominican Republic.
items.content: Melissa strengthened into the most powerful category a hurricane could and could bring "catastrophic" flash flooding and landslides to Jamaica, Haiti and the Dominican Republic.

items.title: 'Life-threatening storm' set to strike Jamaica as Hurricane Melissa strengthens to category 5
items.standfirst: Hurricane Melissa has strengthened to a category 5 storm as it tracks towards Jamaica with destructive winds and storm surge, risking catastrophic flooding.
items.content: Hurricane Melissa has strengthened to a category 5 storm as it tracks towards Jamaica with destructive winds and storm surge, risking catastrophic flooding.

items.title: Hurricane Melissa Live Updates, Tracker—Jamaica Faces 'Catastrophic' Impact
items.standfirst: Life-threatening Hurricane Melissa is hurtling towards Jamaica in the Caribbean. Follow Newsweek's live news coverage.
items.content: Life-threatening Hurricane Melissa is hurtling towards Jamaica in the Caribbean. Follow Newsweek's live news coverage.

items.title: Weather tracker: Jamaica braces for its most powerful hurricane as Melissa nears category 5
items.standfirst: Record-breaking hurricane expected to make landfall on Tuesday with 160mph winds, while New Zealand reels from storm damageLATEST: Hurricane Melissa strengthens to category 5 as evacuations ordered in Jamaica’s capital The Caribbean is bracing for Hurricane Melissa, one of the most powerful to ever strike the region. Melissa began as a cluster of thunderstorms off the coast of west Africa, which travelled west and developed into a depression, reaching tropical storm status to the north of Venezuela on 21 October. Rapid intensification over the weekend strengthened Melissa to category 4 as it slowly meandered west through the Caribbean Sea.Melissa is expected to reach category 5 intensity on Monday night, veering north-east towards Jamaica before making landfall on Tuesday by about midday, with peak winds of 160mph (257km/h), which would make it the strongest of only five hurricanes ever recorded to hit Jamaica directly. The most recent, and before now the most powerful, was Hurricane Gilbert in 1988, which brought gusts of 130mph. Continue reading...
items.content: Record-breaking hurricane expected to make landfall on Tuesday with 160mph winds, while New Zealand reels from storm damageLATEST: Hurricane Melissa strengthens to category 5 as evacuations ordered in Jamaica’s capital The Caribbean is bracing for Hurricane Melissa, one of the most powerful to ever strike the region. Melissa began as a cluster of thunderstorms off the coast of west Africa, which travelled west and developed into a depression, reaching tropical storm status to the north of Venezuela on 21 October. Rapid intensification over the weekend strengthened Melissa to category 4 as it slowly meandered west through the Caribbean Sea.Melissa is expected to reach category 5 intensity on Monday night, veering north-east towards Jamaica before making landfall on Tuesday by about midday, with peak winds of 160mph (257km/h), which would make it the strongest of only five hurricanes ever recorded to hit Jamaica directly. The most recent, and before now the most powerful, was Hurricane Gilbert in 1988, which brought gusts of 130mph. Continue reading...

items.title: Jamaica braces as Hurricane Melissa strengthens offshore
items.standfirst: The Category 5 storm, which threatens to dump up to one metre of rain, is moving at a worryingly slow pace.
items.content: The Category 5 storm, which threatens to dump up to one metre of rain, is moving at a worryingly slow pace.

items.title: Caribbean braces for impact as Melissa surges into a Category 4 hurricane
items.standfirst: Hurricane Melissa is expected to make landfall in Jamaica Monday night or Tuesday morning, with local officials warning of possibly catastrophic flooding. The storm, now strengthened into a Category 4 hurricane, has already killed at least four people as it grinds across the Caribbean.
items.content: Hurricane Melissa is expected to make landfall in Jamaica Monday night or Tuesday morning, with local officials warning of possibly catastrophic flooding. The storm, now strengthened into a Category 4 hurricane, has already killed at least four people as it grinds across the Caribbean.

items.title: Hurricane Melissa strengthens as it barrels towards Jamaica
items.standfirst: The rare highest-strength storm is set to hit Jamaica by Tuesday, having already caused two deaths in Haiti.
items.content: The rare highest-strength storm is set to hit Jamaica by Tuesday, having already caused two deaths in Haiti.

ai_summary: Hurricane Melissa intensified to Category 5, posing a threat to Jamaica with destructive winds.
Mandatory evacuations were ordered for vulnerable areas, including Jamaica's capital, Kingston.
The storm is expected to bring catastrophic flooding and torrential rain to the northern Caribbean.
Melissa could become the strongest hurricane to directly hit Jamaica in recent history.
Authorities warn of widespread damage and prolonged power outages due to the hurricane.

clusters.title: Argentina’s Javier Milei hails ‘historic’ win in pivotal elections

items.title: Argentina’s Javier Milei hails ‘historic’ win in pivotal elections

items.content: Country’s dollar-denominated bonds surge after president wins endorsement for free-market reforms

items.title: Midterms in Argentina: Javier Milei wins big in a 'huge boost' to his agenda
items.standfirst: Argentina’s libertarian president Javier Milei scored sweeping victories in Sunday’s midterm elections, winning key districts — including parts of Buenos Aires for the first time — and securing a strong mandate to advance his aggressive free-market agenda, now bolstered by billions in support from the Trump administration, as explained by journalist Lucia Cholakian.
items.content: Argentina’s libertarian president Javier Milei scored sweeping victories in Sunday’s midterm elections, winning key districts — including parts of Buenos Aires for the first time — and securing a strong mandate to advance his aggressive free-market agenda, now bolstered by billions in support from the Trump administration, as explained by journalist Lucia Cholakian.

items.title: Trump hails Milei’s Argentina win, says U.S. made ‘lot of money’
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump hailed Javier Milei after the Argentine president’s political party staged a comeback victory in Sunday’s midterm elections, vindicating the extraordinary financial backing the US arranged for its South American ally. “That was a big win,” Trump told reporters on Air…
items.content: US President Donald Trump hailed Javier Milei after the Argentine president’s political party staged a comeback victory in Sunday’s midterm elections, vindicating the extraordinary financial backing the US arranged for its South American ally. “That was a big win,” Trump told reporters on Air…

items.title: Trump hails 'big win' for ally Milei in Argentina's midterm elections
items.standfirst: Argentina’s libertarian president, Javier Milei, has won key midterm victories, backed by billions from the Donald Trump administration.
items.content: Argentina’s libertarian president, Javier Milei, has won key midterm victories, backed by billions from the Donald Trump administration.

items.title: Javier Milei hails ‘tipping point’ as his far-right party wins Argentina’s midterm elections
items.standfirst: Result falls short of giving Milei a congressional majority but surprises many analysts after series of scandalsThe party of Argentina’s far-right president, Javier Milei, has won Sunday’s midterm elections after a campaign in which Donald Trump announced a $40bn bailout for the country and made continued aid conditional on the victory of his Argentinian counterpart.With more than 95% of ballots counted, La Libertad Avanza secured 40.84% of the nationwide vote, in an election widely seen as a de facto referendum on the self-styled anarcho-capitalist’s nearly two years in power. The Peronist opposition, Fuerza Patria, secured 31.67%. Continue reading...
items.content: Result falls short of giving Milei a congressional majority but surprises many analysts after series of scandalsThe party of Argentina’s far-right president, Javier Milei, has won Sunday’s midterm elections after a campaign in which Donald Trump announced a $40bn bailout for the country and made continued aid conditional on the victory of his Argentinian counterpart.With more than 95% of ballots counted, La Libertad Avanza secured 40.84% of the nationwide vote, in an election widely seen as a de facto referendum on the self-styled anarcho-capitalist’s nearly two years in power. The Peronist opposition, Fuerza Patria, secured 31.67%. Continue reading...

items.title: Argentina’s Milei celebrates as early results show election win
items.standfirst: Argentina’s President Javier Milei sang to his supporters after early results showed he had won the country’s midterm el
items.content: Argentina’s President Javier Milei sang to his supporters after early results showed he had won the country’s midterm el

items.title: Milei triumphs in Argentine midterm elections closely watched by Washington
items.standfirst: President Milei won in key districts in an election widely seen as a referendum on his past two years in office. Trump had appeared to condition billions of dollars in backing on a good showing for Milei.
items.content: President Milei won in key districts in an election widely seen as a referendum on his past two years in office. Trump had appeared to condition billions of dollars in backing on a good showing for Milei.(Image credit: Rodrigo Abd)

items.title: Milei wins high-stakes Argentina elections
items.standfirst: Voters back President Javier Milei's economic reforms in closely watched midterm polls.
items.content: Voters back President Javier Milei's economic reforms in closely watched midterm polls.

items.title: US-backed Milei scores surprise midterm win, revives Argentina reform drive
items.standfirst: Argentina’s libertarian President Javier Milei scored a surprise victory in Sunday’s midterm elections, bolstering his embattled reform drive. His La Libertad Avanza party won 40.84% of votes for Congress, far outpacing the opposition and marking a rebound for the US-backed right-winger after months of economic turmoil and political resistance.
items.content: Argentina’s libertarian President Javier Milei scored a surprise victory in Sunday’s midterm elections, bolstering his embattled reform drive. His La Libertad Avanza party won 40.84% of votes for Congress, far outpacing the opposition and marking a rebound for the US-backed right-winger after months of economic turmoil and political resistance.

ai_summary: Javier Milei's party secured key victories in Argentina's midterm elections on Sunday.
Milei's party won key districts, including parts of Buenos Aires for the first time.
The election results are seen as a boost to Milei's free-market agenda.
Donald Trump hailed Milei's victory, and the US provided financial backing.
The results fell short of giving Milei a congressional majority.

items.title: 10/26: Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan
items.standfirst: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan, amid President Trump and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's trip to Asia, Bessent joins to discuss the Chinese tariffs, the TikTok deal and the government shutdown at home. Plus. House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries joins to discuss the government shutdown.
items.content: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan, amid President Trump and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's trip to Asia, Bessent joins to discuss the Chinese tariffs, the TikTok deal and the government shutdown at home. Plus. House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries joins to discuss the government shutdown.

items.title: US and China agree ‘framework’ for trade deal ahead of Xi-Trump meeting
items.standfirst: US treasury secretary anticipates tariff truce with China will be extended, and that China will revive substantial purchases of US soybeansThe US and China have agreed a framework for a trade deal just days before Donald Trump and Chinese president Xi Jinping are due to meet.Treasury secretary Scott Bessent said the agreement, forged on the sidelines of the Association of south-east Asian Nations (Asean) summit in Malaysia on Sunday, would remove the threat of the imposition of 100% tariffs on Chinese imports starting on 1 November and include “a final deal” on the sale of TikTok in the US. Continue reading...
items.content: US treasury secretary anticipates tariff truce with China will be extended, and that China will revive substantial purchases of US soybeansThe US and China have agreed a framework for a trade deal just days before Donald Trump and Chinese president Xi Jinping are due to meet.Treasury secretary Scott Bessent said the agreement, forged on the sidelines of the Association of south-east Asian Nations (Asean) summit in Malaysia on Sunday, would remove the threat of the imposition of 100% tariffs on Chinese imports starting on 1 November and include “a final deal” on the sale of TikTok in the US. Continue reading...

items.title: Bessent says additional 100% tariffs on China are "effectively off the table"
items.standfirst: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said 100% tariffs on China are "effectively off the table" after a "very good two-day meeting" between the U.S. and China.
items.content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said 100% tariffs on China are "effectively off the table" after a "very good two-day meeting" between the U.S. and China.

items.title: US and China reach ‘final deal’ on TikTok sale, treasury secretary says
items.standfirst: Scott Bessent said plan was part of framework for trade deal but did not share details on transferring app’s ownershipMurdoch, Ellison and China: what we know about the US’s TikTok dealUS treasury secretary Scott Bessent claimed on Sunday that the US and China have finalized the details of a deal transferring TikTok’s US version to new owners.“We reached a final deal on TikTok,” Bessent said on Sunday on CBS’s Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan. Alluding to Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, Bessent continued: “We reached [a deal] in Madrid, and I believe that as of today, all the details are ironed out, and that will be for the two leaders to consummate that transaction” during a meeting scheduled for Thursday in Korea. Continue reading...
items.content: Scott Bessent said plan was part of framework for trade deal but did not share details on transferring app’s ownershipMurdoch, Ellison and China: what we know about the US’s TikTok dealUS treasury secretary Scott Bessent claimed on Sunday that the US and China have finalized the details of a deal transferring TikTok’s US version to new owners.“We reached a final deal on TikTok,” Bessent said on Sunday on CBS’s Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan. Alluding to Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, Bessent continued: “We reached [a deal] in Madrid, and I believe that as of today, all the details are ironed out, and that will be for the two leaders to consummate that transaction” during a meeting scheduled for Thursday in Korea. Continue reading...

items.title: TikTok deal to be finalized Thursday, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says
items.standfirst: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the TikTok deal announced last month is set to be finalized on Thursday when President Trump meets with Chinese President Xi Jinping.
items.content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the TikTok deal announced last month is set to be finalized on Thursday when President Trump meets with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

items.title: Trump kicks off Asia tour with Xi meeting on the agenda
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump started his Asia tour in Malaysia Sunday by rewarding Cambodia and Thailand with trade deals after co-signing their ceasefire pact, and saying he was confident of a "great" trade deal at upcoming talks with China's Xi Jinping. Trump brimmed with confidence ahead of the meeting with Xi in South Korea, that seeks to end the bruising trade war between the world's two biggest economies.
items.content: US President Donald Trump started his Asia tour in Malaysia Sunday by rewarding Cambodia and Thailand with trade deals after co-signing their ceasefire pact, and saying he was confident of a "great" trade deal at upcoming talks with China's Xi Jinping. Trump brimmed with confidence ahead of the meeting with Xi in South Korea, that seeks to end the bruising trade war between the world's two biggest economies.

items.title: Has Trump's 'peace deal' solved the Thailand-Cambodia dispute?
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has claimed to have ended another war, this time between Thailand and Cambodia. But what does this latest agreement actually amount to?
items.content: Donald Trump has claimed to have ended another war, this time between Thailand and Cambodia. But what does this latest agreement actually amount to?

items.title: Trump oversees Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire signing as Asia tour gets under way
items.standfirst: Trump has begun a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in JanuaryDonald Trump has overseen the signing of a ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia on the first day of an Asia tour where he will seal new trade agreements and hold a crucial meeting with Xi Jinping.The US president arrived in Malaysia on Sunday before the Asean summit in the capital, Kuala Lumpur. At a ceasefire ceremony in front of a sign that read “Delivering Peace”, the Thai prime minister, Anutin Charnvirakul, and his Cambodian counterpart, Hun Manet, signed an expanded ceasefire deal related to a deadly five-day conflict in July. Continue reading...
items.content: Trump has begun a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in JanuaryDonald Trump has overseen the signing of a ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia on the first day of an Asia tour where he will seal new trade agreements and hold a crucial meeting with Xi Jinping.The US president arrived in Malaysia on Sunday before the Asean summit in the capital, Kuala Lumpur. At a ceasefire ceremony in front of a sign that read “Delivering Peace”, the Thai prime minister, Anutin Charnvirakul, and his Cambodian counterpart, Hun Manet, signed an expanded ceasefire deal related to a deadly five-day conflict in July. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump presides over Thai-Cambodia 'peace deal' - but what does it mean?
items.standfirst: Trump calls it historic, Thailand only calls it "a pathway to peace", but all sides hope the agreement will stick.
items.content: Trump calls it historic, Thailand only calls it "a pathway to peace", but all sides hope the agreement will stick.

items.title: Trump touts his peacemaking skills as Thailand and Cambodia sign ceasefire deal
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump kicked off his trip to Asia on Sunday by presiding over the signing of an enhanced ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia that he helped mediate earlier this year.
items.content: President Donald Trump kicked off his trip to Asia on Sunday by presiding over the signing of an enhanced ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia that he helped mediate earlier this year.

items.title: Trump says he's ended eight wars in eight months
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump has claimed he is now responsible for bringing to an end eight wars, as he visited Malaysia to oversee the signing of an expanded ceasefire deal between Thailand and Cambodia.
items.content: US President Donald Trump has claimed he is now responsible for bringing to an end eight wars, as he visited Malaysia to oversee the signing of an expanded ceasefire deal between Thailand and Cambodia.

items.title: Trump arrives in Asia with trade — and tensions with Xi — on the agenda
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump arrived in Southeast Asia on Sunday for his first visit to the continent since returning to office, a three-nation tour through Malaysia, Japan and South Korea that is expected to culminate in a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, as tensions between the world’s two biggest economies tick higher.
items.content: President Donald Trump arrived in Southeast Asia on Sunday for his first visit to the continent since returning to office, a three-nation tour through Malaysia, Japan and South Korea that is expected to culminate in a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, as tensions between the world’s two biggest economies tick higher.

items.title: Oil and gas firm Petrofac files for administration, putting thousands of jobs at risk
items.standfirst: North Sea contractor says move applies only to its ultimate holding company and it will continue to tradeBusiness live – latest updatesPetrofac, one of the biggest North Sea oil and gas contractors, has filed for administration, putting more than 2,000 jobs in Scotland at risk.The energy services provider said it had applied to the high court of England and Wales to appoint administrators, after it lost a big offshore wind project over its failure to meet contractual obligations. Continue reading...
items.content: North Sea contractor says move applies only to its ultimate holding company and it will continue to tradeBusiness live – latest updatesPetrofac, one of the biggest North Sea oil and gas contractors, has filed for administration, putting more than 2,000 jobs in Scotland at risk.The energy services provider said it had applied to the high court of England and Wales to appoint administrators, after it lost a big offshore wind project over its failure to meet contractual obligations. Continue reading...

items.title: Deadly violence in Cameroon ahead of presidential election results
items.standfirst: Deadly clashes have broken out in Cameroon after opposition candidate Issa Tchiroma declared victory in an election yet
items.content: Deadly clashes have broken out in Cameroon after opposition candidate Issa Tchiroma declared victory in an election yet

items.title: Four killed in Cameroon protests as results due in contested election
items.standfirst: An opposition candidate is challenging the incumbent president's 43-year hold on power.
items.content: An opposition candidate is challenging the incumbent president's 43-year hold on power.

items.title: Cameroon protests turn deadly ahead of presidential election results
items.standfirst: Four people were killed on Sunday in clashes between security forces and opposition protesters in Cameroon’s largest city, Douala, the regional governor said. Supporters of opposition candidate Issa Tchiroma defied a protest ban in several cities ahead of Monday’s expected announcement of presidential election results.
items.content: Four people were killed on Sunday in clashes between security forces and opposition protesters in Cameroon’s largest city, Douala, the regional governor said. Supporters of opposition candidate Issa Tchiroma defied a protest ban in several cities ahead of Monday’s expected announcement of presidential election results.

ai_summary: Deadly clashes occurred in Cameroon after opposition candidate declared victory.
Four people were killed in clashes between security forces and protesters.
Protests defied a ban in several cities before election results.
An opposition candidate is challenging the incumbent president's long hold on power.
The clashes occurred in Cameroon's largest city, Douala.

clusters.title: Unexploded Israeli bombs threaten lives as Gaza clears debris, finds bodies

items.title: Unexploded Israeli bombs threaten lives as Gaza clears debris, finds bodies
items.standfirst: Israel restricts heavy machinery but allows Red Cross and Egyptian teams to enter Gaza to search for captives' remains.
items.content: Israel restricts heavy machinery but allows Red Cross and Egyptian teams to enter Gaza to search for captives' remains.

items.title: Red Cross, Egyptian teams join search for dead hostages in Gaza
items.standfirst: Teams from the Red Cross and Egypt have joined the search for the remains of hostages still buried in the rubble of the devastated Gaza Strip, an Israeli spokesperson said Sunday. Hamas said it has widened its search for the dead hostages, whose return is fundamental to the US-brokered ceasefire.
items.content: Teams from the Red Cross and Egypt have joined the search for the remains of hostages still buried in the rubble of the devastated Gaza Strip, an Israeli spokesperson said Sunday. Hamas said it has widened its search for the dead hostages, whose return is fundamental to the US-brokered ceasefire.

items.title: Israel allows Red Cross and Egyptian teams into Gaza as search for bodies of hostages widens
items.standfirst: International teams searching for the bodies of hostages have been allowed to cross Israel's military boundary in Gaza, according to an Israeli government spokesperson.
items.content: International teams searching for the bodies of hostages have been allowed to cross Israel's military boundary in Gaza, according to an Israeli government spokesperson.

ai_summary: Red Cross and Egyptian teams joined the search for hostage remains in Gaza.
Israel allows international teams to search for bodies of hostages.
Hamas widened its search for dead hostages.
Unexploded Israeli bombs pose a threat in Gaza.
The search is happening in the rubble of the devastated Gaza Strip.

clusters.title: French police arrest suspects linked to Louvre jewellery heist
clusters.neutral_headline: Arrests Made in Louvre Jewel Heist

items.title: French police arrest suspects linked to Louvre jewellery heist
items.standfirst: Suspects have been arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre museum, the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday, a week after the heist that stunned the world. The prosecutor said that investigators made the arrests on Saturday evening, adding that one of the men taken into custody was preparing to leave the country from Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport.
items.content: Suspects have been arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre museum, the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday, a week after the heist that stunned the world. The prosecutor said that investigators made the arrests on Saturday evening, adding that one of the men taken into custody was preparing to leave the country from Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport.

items.title: Arrests made in Louvre jewel heist, French prosecutors say
items.standfirst: French police have made arrests in connection with the heist of France’s crown jewels from the Louvre Museum in Paris, officials said Sunday
items.content: French police have made arrests in connection with the heist of France’s crown jewels from the Louvre Museum in Paris, officials said Sunday

items.title: Prosecutor furious as news leaks of Louvre heist gang arrests
items.standfirst: Two men have been arrested following a robbery at the Louvre museum in Paris which saw thieves escape with priceless jewellery, including part of the French crown jewels.
items.content: Two men have been arrested following a robbery at the Louvre museum in Paris which saw thieves escape with priceless jewellery, including part of the French crown jewels.

ai_summary: French police arrested suspects linked to the Louvre jewel heist.

clusters.title: US warship docks in Trinidad and Tobago, putting more pressure on Venezuela
clusters.neutral_headline: US Warship Docks in Trinidad and Tobago

items.title: US warship docks in Trinidad and Tobago, putting more pressure on Venezuela
items.standfirst: The USS Gravely docked in Trinidad and Tobago as US military pressure on Venezuela rises. Maduro condemned it as a “new eternal war,” while Donald Trump accused him of leading a criminal gang. Tensions recently escalated after the US struck Venezuelan ships suspected of involvement in narcotrafficking, heightening fears of a military confrontation in the region.

items.content: A US warship has docked in the capital of Trinidad and Tobago, as US President Donald Trump increases military pressure on Venezuela.

items.title: US warship docks in Trinidad and Tobago as Trump steps up military pressure on Venezuela
items.standfirst: A US guided missile destroyer docked in the twin-island nation of Trinidad and Tobago Sunday as the administration of US President Donald Trump continued its campaign of military pressure against Venezuela. The USS Gravely will remain in Trinidad until Thursday, said US officials.
items.content: A US guided missile destroyer docked in the twin-island nation of Trinidad and Tobago Sunday as the administration of US President Donald Trump continued its campaign of military pressure against Venezuela. The USS Gravely will remain in Trinidad until Thursday, said US officials.

clusters.title: Ten people go on trial in Paris for online harassment of Brigitte Macron
clusters.neutral_headline: Trial Begins in Paris for Brigitte Macron Harassment

items.title: Ten people go on trial in Paris for online harassment of Brigitte Macron
items.standfirst: Trial is latest phase in legal battle against false claim that French first lady is a man named Jean-Michel TrogneuxTen people are to go on trial in Paris on Monday for online harassment of Brigitte Macron – the latest phase in a legal battle on both sides of the Atlantic against the false claim that the French first lady is a man named Jean-Michel Trogneux.The French trial comes after the president, Emmanuel Macron, and his wife filed a defamation lawsuit in the US at the end of July, in connection with a rumour amplified and repeated online that Brigitte Macron was born a man. Continue reading...
items.content: Trial is latest phase in legal battle against false claim that French first lady is a man named Jean-Michel TrogneuxTen people are to go on trial in Paris on Monday for online harassment of Brigitte Macron – the latest phase in a legal battle on both sides of the Atlantic against the false claim that the French first lady is a man named Jean-Michel Trogneux.The French trial comes after the president, Emmanuel Macron, and his wife filed a defamation lawsuit in the US at the end of July, in connection with a rumour amplified and repeated online that Brigitte Macron was born a man. Continue reading...

items.title: Ten people face trial in Paris over sexist cyber-harassment of Brigitte Macron
items.standfirst: Ten people accused of sexist cyber-harassment against Brigitte Macron go on trial in Paris on Monday. The trial over false claims that the French first lady was assigned male at birth comes months after she and President Emmanuel Macron filed a defamation lawsuit in the US over the disinformation campaign.
items.content: Ten people accused of sexist cyber-harassment against Brigitte Macron go on trial in Paris on Monday. The trial over false claims that the French first lady was assigned male at birth comes months after she and President Emmanuel Macron filed a defamation lawsuit in the US over the disinformation campaign.

ai_summary: Ten people are on trial in Paris for online harassment of Brigitte Macron.

The harassment was sexist cyber-harassment.

items.title: Rare earth stocks tumble as U.S. expects China to delay export controls
items.standfirst: Shares of several U.S.-listed rare earth miners fell on Monday as U.S. officials said they expect China to delay introducing export controls on critical minerals as part of a broader trade deal. Critical Metals fell nearly 8% in premarket trade, USA Rare Earth declined 7.4%, MP Materials was down…

clusters.title: Grave fears for civilians after Sudanese paramilitary claims capture of El Fasher
clusters.neutral_headline: Fears Grow in Sudan's El Fasher

items.title: Grave fears for civilians after Sudanese paramilitary claims capture of El Fasher
items.standfirst: RSF says it has seized control of army’s main base in Darfur, home to famine-stricken displacement campFears are growing for hundreds of thousands of civilians trapped in El Fasher after the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces said it had captured the city, which it has been besieging for more than a year in Sudan’s civil war.The group said on Sunday that it had seized control of the army’s main base in the city in Darfur, where famine was declared in a displacement camp last year. It then released a statement saying it had “extended control over the city of El Fasher from the grip of mercenaries and militias”. Continue reading...
items.content: RSF says it has seized control of army’s main base in Darfur, home to famine-stricken displacement campFears are growing for hundreds of thousands of civilians trapped in El Fasher after the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces said it had captured the city, which it has been besieging for more than a year in Sudan’s civil war.The group said on Sunday that it had seized control of the army’s main base in the city in Darfur, where famine was declared in a displacement camp last year. It then released a statement saying it had “extended control over the city of El Fasher from the grip of mercenaries and militias”. Continue reading...

items.title: Fears for civilians trapped in Sudan's El-Fasher intensifies as fighting flares
items.standfirst: The governor of Sudan’s Darfur region on Monday called for the urgent protection for civilians in El-Fasher, after the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces claimed to have seized the last army stronghold in Darfur following an 18-month siege that left the city cut off, devastated, and on the brink of famine.
items.content: The governor of Sudan’s Darfur region on Monday called for the urgent protection for civilians in El-Fasher, after the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces claimed to have seized the last army stronghold in Darfur following an 18-month siege that left the city cut off, devastated, and on the brink of famine.

items.title: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces claim capture of key Darfur city
items.standfirst: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) on Sunday said that it had taken control of the city of El-Fasher, the last major urban centre in western Darfur still outside its control. Local pro-army fighters accused the RSF of running a "media disinformation campaign" and insisted that residents were still fighting the paramilitary group.
items.content: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) on Sunday said that it had taken control of the city of El-Fasher, the last major urban centre in western Darfur still outside its control. Local pro-army fighters accused the RSF of running a "media disinformation campaign" and insisted that residents were still fighting the paramilitary group.

ai_summary: Fears are growing for civilians in El Fasher.
The RSF claimed to have captured the city.
The city has been besieged for over a year.
The governor called for protection of civilians.
The RSF claimed to have seized the army's main base.

As per the terms of the deal, Avidity stockholders will receive $72 per share in…

items.title: Novartis Agrees to Buy Avidity in $12 Billion Biotech Deal
items.standfirst: Novartis AG agreed to buy Avidity Biosciences Inc. in a $12 billion deal that’s the Swiss drugmaker’s biggest acquisition in more than a decade and adds several potential blockbuster treatments as generic competition looms for its current top-sellers.
